intro: Epilobium × mouillefarinei, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in racemose inflorescences, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Epilobium × mouillefarinei is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for pollinators.
